definition: sporting coach/military drill master (in Song times)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He has that effect, does Shearer.
sentences.chinese: 具备这样影响力的教头能有谁？

sentences.english: It is a little bit of an unfair advantage.

definition: to teach/to be a teacher/to train/to coach
foreign teacher (abbr. for 外國教師|外国教师)/greenhorn/novice/amateurish/religion other than Buddhism (term used by Buddhists)
young guard/young and vigorous group with new ideas/new wave
to be in command/(fig.) to dominate over other considerations/to be given overemphasis
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
New Armies (modernized Qing armies, trained and equipped according to Western standards, founded after Japan's victory in the First Sino-Japanese War in 1895)
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
